headline: AppLovin shares rebound after short-seller report
summary: AppLovin (APP) stock is recovering after a 20% drop due to a short-selling report from Muddy Waters. Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton discuss how the company is defending its ad metrics and investigating short-seller activity. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: AppLovin (APP) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of mobile app advertising platform AppLovin (NASDAQ: APP) jumped 9.2% in the pre-market session after CEO Adam Foroughi responded to the concerns raised by short-seller Muddy Waters regarding the company's ad targeting methods and competitiveness. He noted that the short seller's report's bias "lies in omission, not evidence."

He noted that the short seller's report's bias "lies in omission, not evidence."

headline: Lululemon, AppLovin, Rocket Lab: Market Minute
summary: Here are some of the stocks on the move for Friday, March 28. Lululemon (LULU) shares are sinking after issuing a disappointing full-year forecast. AppLovin (APP) has hired a law firm to investigate short seller activity after a third short-selling firm issued a report on the company. Rocket Lab (RKLB) will be competing for a $5.6 billion US Space Force contract. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: AppLovin hires law firm to investigate short seller report

headline: AppLovin Stock Plunged 20% After Short-Seller Report. It’s Bouncing Back.
summary: AppLovin  stock jumped Friday paring some of its losses after plunging 20% in the previous session following a short-seller report.  The advertising technology company’s stock plummeted 20% on Thursday after Muddy Waters Research revealed it had taken a short position.  The investment firm’s report said that AppLovin was “impermissibly extracting proprietary IDs” from the likes of  Meta Snap  TikTok,  Reddit  and Google as a way “to target ads without user consent,” which was likely a violation of the platforms’ terms of service.

raw.headline: AppLovin Stock Plunged 20% After Short-Seller Report. It’s Bouncing Back.
raw.summary: AppLovin  stock jumped Friday paring some of its losses after plunging 20% in the previous session following a short-seller report.  The advertising technology company’s stock plummeted 20% on Thursday after Muddy Waters Research revealed it had taken a short position.  The investment firm’s report said that AppLovin was “impermissibly extracting proprietary IDs” from the likes of  Meta Snap  TikTok,  Reddit  and Google as a way “to target ads without user consent,” which was likely a violation of the platforms’ terms of service.

headline: AppLovin Corp. Retains Quinn Emanuel Firm to Investigate Recent Short Report Activity
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., March 28, 2025--AppLovin Corporation, (NASDAQ: APP) ("AppLovin" or the "Company") today announced that it has retained Alex Spiro, partner and Co-Chair of the Investigations, Government Enforcement & White Collar Defense Practice at Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan, a nationally recognized legal firm with deep expertise in securities and corporate investigations, to conduct an independent review and investigation into recent short report activity targeting the Company.

raw.headline: AppLovin Corp. Retains Quinn Emanuel Firm to Investigate Recent Short Report Activity
